contentrichtext.text: '''Jewel Records''' was a [[record label]] which discs were pressed by the [[Scranton Button Company]]{{Citation needed|date=March 2009}}. Jewel is one of the big three record companies out of [[Cincinnati, Ohio]]. The two most famous, [[King Records (USA)|King Records]] and [[Fraternity Records]], were responsible for several hits over the years from a wide range of genres. Two prominent figures who recorded for Jewel were [[Lonnie Mack]], who did two singles for the label in [[1970 in music|1970]], and [[Albert Washington]]. == See also == * [http://forbiddeneye.com/labels/jewel.html Jewel Records Discography] * [[List of record labels]] [[Category:Defunct record labels of the United States]] [[Category:Pop record labels]] {{US-record-label-stub}}
